title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 140.1 - Filing of annual program necessary
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 140.1 - Filing of annual program necessary

State Regulations

On or before September 1st of each year each county
vocational education and extension board shall file with the Commissioner of

Education for his approval an annual program of educational services to be
rendered, including: (a) copies of all
courses of study to be offered in each school or class; (b) names of supervisors, teachers and all
other persons to be employed for the maintenance of educational services within
the county, including the nature and scope of services to be rendered, centers
of instruction, teaching schedules and general plans for administering and
conducting the services; (c) a copy
of the budget for the school year, indicating the sources of income, estimates
of itemized expenditures and salaries to be paid to each person named in
subdivision (b) of this section; (d) a statement indicating the nature and
scope of the supervision to be provided for the educational services to be
rendered, including the activities of superintendents of schools and special
supervisors; and
(e) copies of
contracts or agreements between the county vocational education and extension
board and local school districts, indicating specific plans and methods of
operating shared educational services among such districts. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
140.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
